conclusion: The graph is symmetric about a dashed line.
The velocity starts at a positive value, decreases to zero, becomes negative, and then returns to the initial positive value at time t1.
The graph is symmetric about a dashed line, indicating that the motion is mirrored around this line.
The particle's motion is periodic or oscillatory within the interval 0 to t1.
The particle passes through a certain position three times within the interval 0 to t1.
The particle moves away from the position, returns to it, moves away again, and then returns once more.
The particle's motion is oscillatory, moving back and forth through a certain position three times within the interval 0 to t1.
The symmetry of the graph supports the idea of periodic motion, where the particle's velocity changes direction twice, resulting in three crossings of the same position.
